title: Skip landing page for authenticated returning users and redirect to dashboard

requirements.text: When a user is authenticated (Internet Identity is present) and visits the home route (/), automatically redirect them to the seller dashboard route (/seller-dashboard) so the public landing page never renders for authenticated users.

quotes: হুম হয়েছে সমস্যা আরো একটা এটা হলো প্রথম ফ্রী ট্রায়াল এর মধ্যে লগইন করার পর আর লেন্ডিং পেইজ প্রয়োজন নেই যত বার ডুকবে ডাইরেক্ট ডাসবোর্ডে চলে যাবে লেন্ডিং পেইজ আর শো করবেনা এই রকম করে দিন

acceptanceCriteria: Given an authenticated user, when they navigate to /, they are redirected to /seller-dashboard without seeing the landing page UI.
Given an unauthenticated user, when they navigate to /, they still see the public landing page as before.
Navigating directly to non-home routes (e.g., /products, /suppliers, /seller-dashboard) continues to behave as it does today (protected by auth gating where applicable).

requirements.text: Ensure the existing onboarding redirect logic (onboardingStorage redirect target set by the landing page 'Start free trial') continues to work, and that it does not conflict with the new authenticated / -> /seller-dashboard redirect (i.e., onboarding redirect should still take precedence when present).

quotes: প্রথম ফ্রী ট্রায়াল এর মধ্যে লগইন করার পর আর লেন্ডিং পেইজ প্রয়োজন নেই

acceptanceCriteria: If onboardingStorage has a redirect target set (e.g., /seller-dashboard) and the user completes login, the app navigates to that target and clears the stored redirect target.
If onboardingStorage has a redirect target set to a non-home route, that target is used after login even if the user lands on /.
After redirect, refreshing the app while still authenticated does not show the landing page at /; it redirects to /seller-dashboard.

constraints: Do not change the authentication mechanism (must continue using Internet Identity).
Do not change the existing route paths (/, /seller-dashboard, etc.).
Keep all other routes’ authentication gating behavior unchanged.
nonGoals: Changing any landing page marketing content or design.
Adding new backend endpoints or modifying backend data schemas.
Implementing email-based login or magic link flows.
